etymologies: late 15th century: from Old English tāda ‘toad’ + poll (probably because the tadpole seems to consist of a large head and a tail in its early development stage)

definitions: the tailed aquatic larva of an amphibian (frog, toad, newt, or salamander), breathing through gills and lacking legs until the later stages of its development.
shortDefinitions: tailed aquatic larva of amphibian frog, toad, newt
